item.title: Ai is about to crash the economy — 20 replies — 28.0/hr
item.content:encoded:
Ai is about to crash the economy

Open thread • Replies: 20 • Updated: 2026-02-23 23:06 UTC

OP

This was released today by citrini

AI gets good. Companies lay off workers. Margins expand. Stocks rip. S&P hits 8,000. Everyone celebrates.

• But fired workers stop spending. Companies weaken. They buy more AI to cut costs. More layoffs. Less spending. A negative feedback loop with no natural brake.

• The top 10% of earners drive 50%+ of all consumer spending. They're the ones getting replaced. A $180K product manager ends up driving Uber for $45K. Multiply that across every major city.

• Ghost GDP emerges - the economy is "growing" on paper, but the money never reaches real people. Productivity is booming. Wages are collapsing.

• Then it hits housing. $13 trillion in mortgages, all underwritten on one assumption: you keep your job for 30 years. In 2008, the loans were bad on day one. In 2028, the loans were good. The world just changed after they were written.

• S&P crashes 38% from highs. Unemployment hits 10.2%. Markets barely react anymore.

• The punchline: you're not reading this in 2028. You're reading it in February 2026. Every domino they describe has already started falling.

Early replies (first 3)

61889750
WAOW! Link me to this guy's substack payment page immediately!!!!!

61889754
There's over a billion jeets you can just keep vacuuming up the top 10% of them to always have an american middle class

Latest replies (last 30, oldest → newest)

61889795
>>61889737

61889812
>>61889737

The rest of the shit is due to inflation, first from covid supply shocks, then companies trying to squeeze every last dollar they could out of the consumer and now trump tariffs. AI hasn't even begun to displace people.

61890390
>What AI thinks
Argument That LINK Is a Security
Under the Howey test (SEC v. W.J. Howey Co.), an asset is a security if there is:
>An investment of money
>In a common enterprise
>With a reasonable expectation of profit
>Derived from the efforts of others
LINK can arguably meet all four elements:
>Investment of money:
People buy LINK with capital.
>Common enterprise:
The value of LINK rises and falls with the success of the Chainlink ecosystem.
>Expectation of profit:
Many buyers hold LINK expecting price appreciation, not immediate utility use.
>Efforts of others:
The value of LINK depends significantly on the continued development, partnerships, and ecosystem growth driven by Chainlink Labs.

Additionally, the original token distribution helped fund development, which resembles capital formation typical of securities offerings.

Thoughts anons? Is this class actionable?

item.title: European funds for an american — 24 replies — 14.4/hr
item.content:encoded:
European funds for an american

Open thread • Replies: 24 • Updated: 2026-02-23 22:09 UTC

OP

I want to put 20% of my account in foreign, but not all foreign is created equal.

I predicted the rise in the polish economy. It's very simple, a homogenous white country free from communism is always going to become rich. A diverse country full of communists like Canada and South Africa is going to get worse and worse.

I also predicted that the real-estate market in Croatia would sky rocket due to whites fleeing countries like the UK. I was right.

So.... are there any good mutual/index funds that target the white regions of Europe, that an American can invest in? Is there a Balkans fund? A Baltic fund? Norway/Finland fund (not Sweden or Denmark)? I do not want to invest in the UK, France, Germany, or Spain.

Early replies (first 3)

61890485
>finland
>white

61890499
>please buy my bag
nein. Death to every communist, that includes every single member of a political party, everyone over 50, every bureaucrat and every single subsidized "private" which in europe is every company.

61890518
No fucking way those numbers on finland are right. I live in Helsinki and it’s like 25% brown.

Latest replies (last 30, oldest → newest)

61890524
>>61890472
You are correct about Poland but everybody knew and knows about Poland but nobody wants to talk about why they've been the hottest economy in Europe for 15 years (white and Christian).

Anyway. You've never heard of EPOL?
I've owned the Polish index tracker ETFs for 8 years and it has done nicely.

Otherwise, Baltics do have stock markets but they are Frontier markets (this is below emerging markets) and you basically can't buy them if you're not in the country.

Norway invests in U.S. stocks. So does Sweden and their banks. Hottest Swedish bank stock is 100% invested in NYSE traded companies. So it's circular. If you invest in European banks or Norway you're actually buying U.S. stocks with extra steps. EPOL is heavily weighted towards Polish banks and you guessed it - they all hold U.S. company stocks.

European Bank customers are just a source of capital to invest in the New York Stock Exchange. And I'm an insider so I know.

If you want an actual good EU based investment buy WDEF. European defense spending will be hot for 15 years. Otherwise buy Spotify and the upcoming revolut IPO.

61890543
>>61890524

Medical services will always be the last to go even under socialism since Europeans will bankrupt their country with debt before they let a hospital go bankrupt.

61890855
>>61890543

>t. American in Latvia who knows Poland pretty well (dated a Polish chick and been there many times).

61891003
>>61890989

>>61890472

not Sweden

61891154
>>61890855
I have friends who moved to Croatia. Reason? White flight from the UK. Highly productive middle class white people pouring out of one area and into another, means good things for one economy and bad things for the other. It's no different than watching the small cities that surround Akron, Cleveland, Chicago, Detroit, Oakland, Baltimore, etc... All get richer and richer and have better and better economies due to all of the whites in those cities pouring out into the surrounding areas.

You say it's not that simple, yet I've told people this will happen and for 30 years, I've been right. I watched the real estate market in Croatia skyrocket into the stratosphere. I've also made a lot of money on real-estate outside of Cleveland and Akron just by investing in the white flight destinations.

>>61891134
Yes. That's why I said funds that invest in Norway and Finland, but not Denmark and Sweden. I know Finland isn't really Nordic but they're next door.

61891236
>>61891154
That's fine but from the average person's perspective you can't understand the bigger economic picture and appreciate the vast differences in market size and capital flows.
Life for average people may be more or less similar in Croatia and England but the English stock exchange is in another universe compared to these small economies.
As I said, I'm an American living in Latvia. My life is better in Latvia. I'm just a normal guy. The top 1% and .01% would see things quite differently. Where does one park $100,000,000 in the Baltics?
Answer: you don't. And downstream from that is YOU don't get to invest $50,000 in an Estonia market ETF either. These are frontier markets not even as developed as Brazil or India.

61891374
>>61891236
I think real-estate, and downstream from that medical services, are pretty simple by and large because they're mostly just a matter of predicting the migration patterns of middle class white people, while avoiding the political behavior of lumpenprole voters. At a bare minimum investing in medical services and realestate are a safe bet in any communist free white flight destination.

Question then becomes, what financial products are available to me that resemble that in any way.

There's a fund called NHCBHFFT that invests in real estate in estonia, for example.

>>61890472
>I do not want to invest in the UK
FTSE100 has been outperforming the S&P500 for a while now but okay

61891622
>>61891396
I want a stock that will perform well long term, the UK, like Canada and South Africa, has not future unless it claws it's way back from Weimar conditions. The massive white flight that has already taken place and has been accelerating, looks exactly how things looked for Detroit, Chicago, Oakland, Baltimore, etc...

Ghettofication is an economy killer. Because people ignore it and it makes people irrational, that is the area an investor can exploit.

61892062
>>61890472
Brown migration is stagnating across Europe and so is the birthrate of migrants of the 2nd/3rd generation. The number of migrants are not big enough to not be outbred in the long run.

61892245
>>61890472

Now Bulgarian gypsies are also abroad and the roles are reversed, lol (except for France, that's only getting worse).

61892365
>>61892062
sounds like copium

61892695
>>61892062
White flight is the real economy killer. Again, look at all the places already mentioned. Niggers in america don't have exceptional birthrates but once they're 20% of a city everyone else runs away. Same as true for states and countries. Most nigger cities in America have half the population they had the in 60s. Akron and Cleveland have lost about half of their population due to white flight.

61892982
>>61890855
This.
I’m polish and I can explain a bit just to give a gist.
Poland’s “capitalist” period started in ‘89 so to this day the biggest companies included in WIG20 are completely controlled by National Treasury. So 8 of them constitute about 55% of the index.
So mind you by loading up on indexes you’re not really buying innovation rather iron clad businesses that aren’t really growth oriented.
Let’ take an example of searching for growth sectors like everyone talks about polish developers so it would be safe to assume that IT stuff has growth potential.
And here the biggest IT company is CD project which makes fucking games a dying industry that will be killed by small teams with ai making indie games.
Rest of well known IT firms are privately owned or controlled by ventures.
It’s hard to really find good stuff I personally think you should search for companies making tangible products or services example solar panels, beauty sector, pharma.
We’ve got a lot of ecomerce, construction, pharma/cosmetics, news outlets. Not really innovative stuff.

I mean I wish it was different but really if someone made something meaningful here he would be molested to death by venture capital like CVC Capital Partners and eventually cave in take cash run and live a beautiful trad life in Bielsko Biała.

61893067
>>61892982
Cont.
So to comparing to the US, Poland is a polar opposite.
In the US Capital lobbies politics. In Poland the only people who can lobby are foreign players and people with political power. And this political power has more influence on the stock market while in the US stock market and capital makes politics.
The end communist era ripples through Poland up to this day. The people responsible for the transition made themselves very powerful and control the capital to this day. The good news it that their descendants are retarded beyond comprehension and will be unable to maintain power.
